profile_positions.description:
SANEC (Southern African Netherlands Chamber of Commerce & Industry) was founded 25 years ago by high level businessmen in collaboration with The Netherlands and South African Government as a Bilateral Business Chamber of Commerce & Industry. SANEC is a non – for – profit private international Business Chamber of Commerce & Industry with a mandate to operate in a Bilateral manner. SANEC  has at its disposal an extensive network within the Benelux  and Southern African governments in addition to the business community, engendering a situation where SANEC can be used effectively by our members as a hub for specific market information and insights. 

SANEC operates from The Hague in the Netherlands, with offices in the World Trade Center. From the Hague we cover the Benelux region and work with local SANEC business associates. Moreover SANEC has offices in Johannesburg and a Representative office in Cape Town, South Africa. The SADC (Southern African Development Community) region is covered via local SANEC Business Associates.

Our strategic partners in the regions are local chamber of commences, local investment agencies, local export councils and local sector councils.

With our local team of experts and over 25 years of experience, SANEC is the Trilateral expert for doing business between 15 countries in SADC, Benelux  and the Middle East region. We do this by assisting our over 400 members and too non – members through our network of decision makers of multinationals, large medium and small enterprises, knowledge institutes, innovation centres (including universities), NGO’s, local business associations and (semi) governmental departments both national and local. Meaning SANEC as the gateway for doing business between Southern Africa, Benelux and the Middle East  has a Database of hundreds of companies and associates due to our strategic alliances and partnerships in our operating regions.

profile_positions.description:
The Australia Arab Chamber of Commerce & Industry (AACCI) is the peak national association for two-way trade and investment between Australia and the Arab League countries. AACCI is a member of the General Union of Arab Chamber of Commerce & Industry (GUACCIA) and has fostered strong links with the Australian State and Federal governments since it began in 1975.

AACCI's mission is to assist Australian companies exporting to or expanding into Middle East and North African (MENA) markets and Arab companies looking to invest in Australia. We specialise in providing members with commercial intelligence, business matching and networking opportunities. Our program of members' events features Australian and Arabic speakers with MENA-focussed business expertise, creating great opportunities for members to network and gather up-to-date commercial intelligence on the Arab business world.
